text: {"answer": "F", "reasoning": "All four statements are incorrect. (i) Swiss civil judgments generally have res judicata effect only between the parties (inter partes), not erga omnes. (ii) The Federal Council has seven members who are equal in rank; there is no Prime Minister. The Federal President is merely primus inter pares with no power to dissolve the Federal Assembly. (iii) A penal order (Strafbefehl) can be issued for a custodial sentence of up to 6 months, not 12 months (Art. 352 CPC). (iv) Luhmann's autopoietic systems theory holds that law and politics are operationally closed, self-referential systems; law does not 'trigger democratic impulse' in politics â€” they are structurally coupled but autonomous."}
